feed.title: Sencha Blog
feed.author: tracy.pullman@sencha.com
feed.description: Technical articles, company news, and customer spotlights from Sencha.

entries.title: Rock Out at SenchaCon 2013
entries.author: Tracy Pullman
entries.contentSnippet: This year’s event is going to be off the hook! We’ve got an amazing venue with dozens of amenities and ...
entries.content:
This SenchaCon is going to be off the hook! You’ll be at an amazing venue with dozens of amenities and conveniences. Check out the SenchaCon Flickr stream to see some of the photos from our recent site visit in Orlando.

Photos and words cannot do the Disney Swan & Dolphin Resort justice, so you'll have to trust me when I say the SenchaCon venue is impressive! The resort itself is huge. I realized just how expansive it truly was when I told my cabdriver that I was going to the Swan & Dolphin and he said, “Which one?”

The convenience of rolling out of bed and walking downstairs directly to SenchaCon is a key reason you’ll love the Swan & Dolphin. But there’s also the 17 restaurants, 5 pools, state-of-the-art gym, water taxi to Epcot & Hollywood Studios and shuttle buses to Disney Magic Kingdom, Animal Kingdom and Downtown Disney. Not to mention Extra Magic Hours, where each day one of the theme parks opens an hour early and stays open late for Swan & Dolphin guests! You are also walking distance to the Disney Boardwalk where you can watch fireworks, check out the dueling piano bar, ESPN Club, grab a drink at Big River Grille & Brewing Works or just go for a stroll.

The hotel is already sold out to the general public, but we still have rooms available in our room block. You can reserve a room when you register for SenchaCon. If you have already registered, but did not book a room, simply log in from the registration page using your confirmation # and add the hotel room to your registration.

But you are not coming to Orlando for the hotel (although that doesn’t hurt)! If you need more reasons to attend SenchaCon 2013, check out the Top Ten Reasons to Come to SenchaCon 2013

And if you register this week, you will be entered into two giveaways! Attendees who register this week, will be entered into a drawing for a Chromebook Pixel worth $1299!

If you register by Friday, June 7th, you will be entered into our Live Like a Rockstar giveaway, where you could win an upgrade to the Presidential Suite (worth $4200/night), plus a BlackBerry Z10, welcome gift basket and other goodies - this prize package is valued at over $17,000! Check out the Live Like a Rockstar webpage with all the details.

Don’t wait, most of the Sencha community has already registered and begun planning their agendas!

entries.title: Top Ten Reasons to Come to SenchaCon 2013… plus Three Reasons to Register Today
entries.author: Paul Kopacki
entries.contentSnippet: SenchaCon 2013 is coming up fast! Check out our top ten reasons to come to SenchaCon 2013 and the bonuses you get for ...
entries.content:
1. Uniquely valuable content.
    With more than 65 sessions on mobile and web app dev topics — including Ext JS, Sencha Touch, JavaScript, and HTML5 — this is the single best place to be if you are a Sencha or HTML5 developer. http://senchacon.com/sessions/
  2. Powerful speakers.
    SenchaCon features top HTML5 thinkers, community leaders, and the engineers behind all of Sencha's technologies as speakers, all delivering highly practical, technical sessions. http://senchacon.com/speakers/
  3. Be the first.
    We've got some major announcements to make about Ext JS, Touch, and Architect, plus some big news about where we are headed next. You'll be the first to hear about these in the keynote, and we'll be providing early access to many of these exclusively to attendees.
  4. Better apps.
    Learn new tips and techniques for performance optimization, UI/UX, theming, testing, debugging, offline, efficiency, and more. Bring your code, your challenges, and your questions directly to the Sencha technical staff to get face-to-face assistance and information.
  5. Awesome community.
    Some of the world's most amazing developers come to SenchaCon, because they know there is nothing like it. You'll connect with devs from small boutique dev shops, Fortune 100 companies, and everything in between — all of them pushing the boundaries of JavaScript and HTML5, and building cutting-edge apps.
  6. Great event experience.
    The conference is packed with serious content, but the atmosphere is casual and fun, with a large community pavilion for hanging out and coding, or just hanging out. We mix up the days with our mini Unconference, and an epic Hackathon challenge. The after-hours events are designed for enjoyment and interaction, so you can talk shop and build new friendships while having a good time — including our big social event at Universal Studios Islands of Adventure, where we'll have an after-closing party with drinks, food, music, and exclusive access to great rides.
  7. Your boss wants you there!
    SenchaCon is an intense mix of training, learning, coding, and collaboration — you'll be sure to leave a smarter, better skilled, more productive developer with a large network of Sencha community contacts who will continue to help you after the conference. Send her or him this list of reasons, plus a list of the sessions you’d attend and the problems you’ll solve while there, and an approval is imminent.
  8. Talk to leading tech companies.
    BlackBerry, Microsoft, Intel/Tizen, Google, RackSpace, Modus Create, and others are sponsors, and are sending their best evangelists and developers to the event to talk to you. They know how important HTML5 app developers are, they want to understand you and what you are building, and they want you to understand them.
  9. You'll love the location.
    Orlando is easy to get to, with direct flights from major U.S. and European cities. The Swan & Dolphin is a world-class hotel, with a great conference center for the event, and a location in the middle of the Disney property. There's tons to do and see nearby, including the famous theme parks and the NASA facilities at Cape Canaveral — you might want to stick around an extra day or two.
  10. It's THE global Sencha and HTML5 event.
    There are many smaller conferences and meet ups, drawing local audiences and covering a narrower range of topics. But none come close to the genuine SenchaCon experience: 1,000 developers from around the world, dozens of Sencha engineers and technical staff, top Sencha partners, top sponsors, first-class conference facilities, amazing announcements, and more. If you can attend only one conference this year, you should make it SenchaCon.

Plus, three reasons to not delay:

  1. Live Like a Rockstar.
    Register by June 7, and you might win a room upgrade to the Presidential Suite. You have to see it to believe it.
  2. Chrome Pixel.
    Yes, in addition to the chance to live like a Rockstar, we are also giving away a Chrome PIxel to one lucky person drawn at random from this week’s registrants.
  3. The hotel is filling up!
    We still have great rooms available at the special conference rate, but the rest of the hotel is fully booked for regular guests. If you are coming, you will want to be in the Dolphin, so don’t wait!

entries.title: Building SAP mobile apps with Sencha Touch
entries.author: Luc Stakenborg
entries.contentSnippet: If you are working in a large corporate environment, chances are likely that your business data is in SAP systems. SAP is a ...
entries.content:
If you are working in a large corporate environment, chances are likely that your business data is in SAP systems. SAP is a leading enterprise software vendor. Traditionally SAP was a closed environment using proprietary UI solutions. More recently, however, SAP is opening its ecosystem by embracing open web standards and partnering with leading client framework vendors such as Sencha.

In this blog I will show how you can use Sencha Touch to create mobile apps that connect to SAP business data. Our integration will be based on SAP NetWeaver Gateway and Sencha’s SAP OData connector.

OData

So what is OData? OData (Open Data Protocol) is a set of conventions for URLs and data formatting for REST APIs. OData is an open standard and backed by Microsoft, SAP, IBM and others. Check out the OData site and the examples to get a quick impression of the capabilities and conventions of OData.

SAP NetWeaver Gateway

SAP NetWeaver Gateway is a SAP server add-on that allows mobile devices and other consumers to connect to SAP systems using OData-based REST services. The SAP Gateway front-ends various SAP systems like ERP, CRM, SRM and enables controlled read/write access to business data using HTTP and OData.

SAP graciously provides an online demo system where you can test-drive the SAP Gateway. Our mobile app is going to connect to this demo system,but you will need to go through the account registration process to get a demo account. Check out the getting started document. On SCN (SAP Community Network) you will find more information on SAP NetWeaver Gateway and you will also find examples of other integration scenarios, e.g. using SUP (Sybase Unwired Platform, renamed to SAP Mobile Platform in version 2.2) in combination with Sencha Touch.

Sencha SAP OData connector

Last year, Sencha and SAP announced their partnership in the mobile space. As a result, Sencha has delivered an SAP OData proxy which makes it easy for Sencha Touch developers to connect to SAP NetWeaver Gateway. Get the latest version of the Sencha SAP OData connector here! You will need the OData.js file for the sample app below.

Let’s get coding

We’ll build a Sencha Touch app that fetches TravelAgency data from SAP NetWeaver Gateway and displays them in a grouped List. The easiest way to get started with Sencha Touch is to include the hosted library from http://cdn.sencha.io.

Create the following app.html file that includes Sencha Touch JavaScript library and stylesheet:

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
    <title>Hello World</title>
    <!-- include the Sencha Touch stylesheet -->
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="http://cdn.sencha.io/touch/sencha-touch-2.1.0/resources/css/sencha-touch.css"/>
    <!-- include the Sencha Touch library -->
    <script src="http://cdn.sencha.io/touch/sencha-touch-2.1.0/sencha-touch-all-debug.js"></script>
    <!-- include the SAP OData Connector -->
    <script src="OData.js"></script>
    <!-- include your app code -->
    <script src="app.js"></script>
</head>
<body>
</body>
</html>

Now, let’s define the Model for TravelAgency in model/TravelAgency.js, using the SAP OData proxy.

// define the TravelAgency model
Ext.define('App.model.TravelAgency', {
    extend: 'Ext.data.Model',
    requires: 'Ext.data.proxy.OData',
    config: {
        // define the fields. the default type is string
        fields: [
            { name: "TravelAgencyID" },
            { name: "Name" },
            { name: "Street" },
            { name: "POBox" },
            { name: "PostalCode" },
            { name: "City" },
            { name: "Country" },
            { name: "Region" },
            { name: "TelephoneNumber" },
            { name: "URL" },
            { name: "LanguageCode" },
            { name: "LocalCurrencyCode" }
        ],
        proxy: {
            type: 'odata',
            url: 'https://sapes1.sapdevcenter.com/sap/opu/odata/IWBEP/RMTSAMPLEFLIGHT_2/TravelAgencyCollection',
            username: "<yourusername>",
            password: "<yourpassword>",
            withCredentials: true
        }
    }
});

Using the Model, we can define a store for TravelAgencies in store/TravelAgencies.js:

// define a store to load a collection TravelAgency records
Ext.define('App.store.TravelAgencies', {
    extend: 'Ext.data.Store',
    requires: 'App.model.TravelAgency',
    config: {
        model: 'App.model.TravelAgency',
        // automatically load the records when store is created
        autoLoad: true,
        // perform client-side sorting on field Name
        sorters: 'Name',
        // configure grouping
        grouper: {
            // group by the first letter of Name field
            groupFn: function (record) {
                return record.get('Name')[0];
            }
        }
    }
});

Please note that I included a grouper function. It returns the first letter of the Travel Agency’s name and is used to build a grouped list, which we will define next.

The TravelAgencyList view (in view/TravelAgencyList.js) lists the names of the agencies and groups them by first letter:

// define a List to display Travel Agencies
Ext.define('App.view.TravelAgencyList', {
    extend: 'Ext.dataview.List',
    config: {
        grouped: true,
        itemTpl: '{Name}'
    }
});

Finally, we use our building blocks to launch our application in app.js:

Ext.application({
    requires: ['App.store.TravelAgencies', 'App.view.TravelAgencyList'],
    launch: function () {
        // create a store. It autoLoads the TravelAgencies collection from SAP Gateway
        var store = Ext.create('App.store.TravelAgencies');
        // create a list view and bind it to the store
        Ext.create('App.view.TravelAgencyList', {
            fullscreen: true,
            store: store
        });
    }
});

It’s time to fire up your Chrome browser with the “disable-web-security” command line. This will suppress the Same Origin Policy which normally doesn’t allow you to do XHR request across domains:

Now you can view app.html in Chrome, showing the TravelAgencies fetched from SAP Gateway:

We have just built our first Sencha Touch app on top of SAP data! You can use the many UI components in Sencha Touch to create other views on your SAP data. Here are some examples:

Create, update and delete

So far, we have used the SAP OData connector to fetch data from the SAP NetWeaver Gateway server. However, we can modify server data just as well! In the following example we will create, modify and delete a Booking for a Flight in the SAP NetWeaver Gateway Flight service.

We’ll first define a Booking model:

Ext.define('App.model.Booking', {
    extend: 'Ext.data.Model',
    config: {
        fields: [{
            name: 'AirLineID',
            type: 'string'
        }, {
            name: 'FlightConnectionID',
            type: 'string'
        }, {
            name: 'FlightDate',
            type: 'string'
        }, {
            name: 'BookingID',
            type: 'string',
            defaultValue: ""
        }, {
            name: 'CustomerID',
            type: 'string'
        }, {
            name: 'TravelAgencyID',
            type: 'string'
        }, {
            name: 'PassengerName',
            type: 'string'
        }, {
            name: 'CustomerType',
            type: 'string'
        }, {
            name: 'Smoker',
            type: 'boolean'
        }, {
            name: 'LuggageWeight',
            type: 'float'
        }, {
            name: 'WeightUnit',
            type: 'string'
        }, {
            name: 'Invoice',
            type: 'boolean'
        }, {
            name: 'FlightClass',
            type: 'string'
        }, {
            name: 'PriceInForeignCurrency',
            type: 'float'
        }, {
            name: 'ForeignCurrencyCode',
            type: 'string'
        }, {
            name: 'PriceInLocalCurrency',
            type: 'float'
        }, {
            name: 'LocalCurrencyCode',
            type: 'string'
        }, {
            name: 'SalesOfficeID',
            type: 'string'
        }, {
            name: 'BookingDate',
            type: 'string'
        }, {
            name: 'TravelAgencyID',
            type: 'string'
        }, {
            name: 'Cancelled',
            type: 'boolean'
        }, {
            name: 'Reserved',
            type: 'boolean'
        }, {
            name: 'PassengerName',
            type: 'string'
        }, {
            name: 'Title',
            type: 'string'
        }, {
            name: 'PassengerDateOfBirth',
            type: 'string'
        }],
        proxy: {
            type: 'odata',
            url: "https://sapes1.sapdevcenter.com/sap/opu/odata/IWBEP/RMTSAMPLEFLIGHT_2/BookingCollection",
            withCredentials: true,
            username: '<yourusername>',
            password: '<yourpassword>'
        }
    }
});

Now let’s create a booking for a Flight. Please note that there are some required fields that we need to provide:

var booking = Ext.create('App.model.Booking', {
    AirLineID: flight.get('AirLineID'),
    FlightConnectionID: flight.get('FlightConnectionID'),
    FlightDate: flight.get('FlightDate'),
    CustomerID: '00004274',
    TravelAgencyID: '00000087',
    PassengerName: 'Joe Picard'
});
booking.save(function (record, operation) {
    if (operation.wasSuccessful()) {
        console.log('Booking created. Id:' + record.get('BookingID'));
    } else {
        console.log('Create booking failed');
    }
});

Once we have a Booking, we may update its properties:

booking.set('PassengerName', 'Tom Picard');
booking.save(function (record) {
    console.log('Booking updated');
});

To delete the Booking, just use the erase() method on the model:

booking.erase(function () {
   console.log('Booking cancelled');
});

The exact semantics and allowed operations on the SAP data are determined by custom configuration and coding in SAP Netweaver Gateway. In the Flights service, the Booking record is not removed from the database. Instead, the Booking is marked as ‘Cancelled’.

It’s time to wrap up! In this post we have introduced the Sencha SAP OData connector and provided examples how a Sencha Touch app can interact with SAP data through SAP NetWeaver Gateway. I hope this helps you get started with building SAP mobile apps with Sencha Touch. Thanks for reading!

Resources

  • SAP NetWeaver Gateway on SAP Community Network
  • Download Sencha SAP OData connector
  • Get the sample code on GitHub

entries.title: Tizen Support Coming to Sencha Touch!
entries.author: Michael Mullany
entries.contentSnippet: We’re pleased to announce that Sencha Touch will officially support Tizen! This support is the direct result of building ...
entries.content:
We’re pleased to announce that Sencha Touch will officially support Tizen! This support is the direct result of building a close relationship with two key Tizen Association members, Intel and Samsung, and we are excited by their shared vision for the platform and their commitment to HTML5. It promises to be a great partnership that will benefit Sencha and HTML5 developers everywhere.

At this point, we have just kicked off the project and our official partnership, so there’s not a lot to talk about just yet. But we’ll be talking more about what the Sencha experience on Tizen will look like at SenchaCon this summer. So, to learn more, join us and Tizen at SenchaCon 2013. Tizen is now a Platinum sponsor of the Conference, and will be there with their technical team delivering sessions and demoing the latest and greatest.
